## <p align="center">Lab 4  What would the world be like if the Normal Curve had never been discovered?</p>
==
 <p align="center">Shaowei Ding, Jie Liu, Justin Zwolski, Lindsay Rutter </p>
 <p align="left">Four dreadfully normal authors </p>

One day, the Earth ventured a wee-bit too close to a blackhole, and all
the normality it once enjoyed was sucked away forever.

This left the world a scribbled, chicken-scratch mess, as though its blueprint
came from a two-year old wielding a purple crayon: 

```{r, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
qplot(logic, sanity, geom="path", xlab = "Logic", ylab = "Sanity", main="The World - By Tiny Tim") + theme(legend.position = "none")+geom_path(colour = "purple") 
```

![Crayon](/Users/MacOwner/Desktop/Stat585/Storyyy/crayon)

1. The plot of a normal curve
```{r fig.width=8, fig.height=4, fig.align='center'}
x <- seq(-4, 4, length=100)
hx <- dnorm(x)
plot(x, hx, type="l", lty=2, xlab="x value",
  ylab="Density", main="The plot of a Normal Curve")
```

You can also embed plots, for example:
